alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued August 02 at 7:43PM PDT until August 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE MCKINNEY FIRE AND YETI COMPLEX BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the McKinney Fire and Yeti Complex burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Central Siskiyou County and Western Siskiyou County. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the McKinney Fire and Yeti Complex burn scars. Periods of heavy rain are expected with thunderstorms today during the period of the watch. Residents and those who are in or near the McKinney Fire and Yeti Complex burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms that form over these fires today, will likely produce very heavy rainfall that could trigger rock falls or debris flows. Any person in narrow canyons or on steep slopes that have been burned should immediately leave these areas when rain begins. Firefighters should check in with their safety officer and incident meteorologist for more information. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
